interfaces

Interface Edge<V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - Type of vertex that the edge connects.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DirectionalEdge<V>, WeightedDirectionalEdge<V,W>, WeightedEdge<V,W>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEdge, SimpleDirectionalEdge, SimpleEdge, SimpleWeightedDirectionalEdge, SimpleWeightedEdge

    public interface Edge<V>
    Author:
    Matthew D. Jeffreys

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      V getOpposingVertex(V vertex)
      Returns the vertex that opposes the vertex being passed.
      V getVertex(int index) 
      java.util.List<V> getVertices()
      Returns a list containing 2 vertices
      boolean isReciprical(Edge<V> edge)
      Convenience method determines if the passed edge is the reciprocal of this edge.

    • Method Detail

      • getVertices

        java.util.List<V> getVertices()
        Returns a list containing 2 vertices
        Returns:
        List of vertices

      • getVertex

        V getVertex(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - must be either 0 or 1
        Returns:
        V one of 2 vertices, or null if caller passes int !(1 || 0)

      • getOpposingVertex

        V getOpposingVertex(V vertex)
        Returns the vertex that opposes the vertex being passed.
        Parameters:
        vertex -
        Returns:
        V opposite vertex

      • isReciprical

        boolean isReciprical(Edge<V> edge)
        Convenience method determines if the passed edge is the reciprocal of this edge.

        Used to determine edge equivalence in an undirected graph. e.g. edge0 connects A->B, if edge1 B->A is passed to isReciprical method it will return true, this holds true even if the edges are directed.

        Parameters:
        edge - reference to edge who's reciprocity is to be determined.
        Returns:
        true if passed edge is reciprocal of object edge.
